definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple

sentences.english: Throughout much of the cold war Beijing and Moscow were enemies.
sentences.chinese: 在冷戰的許多時間裏，中俄兩國都處於敵對狀態。

sentences.english: The hostility between the weak and the strong, the existence of inequality in our world.
sentences.chinese: 弱者與強者的敵對，世間所存在的不平等性。

sentences.english: We hope and we have suggested that they will do it in manner that is not antagonistic.
sentences.chinese: 我們希望並建議政府不要報以敵對態度來做這件事。

sentences.english: Any long-term antagonistic relationship seemed to harbor this kind of codependency.
sentences.chinese: 任何長期敵對的關係似乎都包容這樣的相互依存。

sentences.english: The hostile parties got to blows and stone-throwing.
sentences.chinese: 敵對雙方互擲石頭，打了起來。

sentences.english: The opposition arising from Washington lawmakers is nothing new.
sentences.chinese: 華盛頓立法者們的敵對態度並非什麼新鮮事。

sentences.english: Goods are shipped thousands of miles out of the way simply to avoid hostile territory.
sentences.chinese: 爲了避開敵對國家，商品的運輸往往要取道數千英里。

sentences.english: Georgian and South Ossetian officials have accused each other of initiating the hostilities.
sentences.chinese: 格魯吉亞和南奧塞梯官員相互指責對方挑起敵對行動。

sentences.english: It is impossible to be allegiant to two opposing forces.
sentences.chinese: 對兩種敵對勢力都忠心效力是不可能的。

sentences.english: Players will no longer be able to whisper to enemy players in Battlegrounds.
sentences.chinese: 玩家在戰場中不可以和敵對玩家悄悄話了。

sentences.english: Pope Benedict XVI also called for an immediate end to the hostilities.
sentences.chinese: 教皇本篤也呼籲立即結束兩國的敵對狀態。

sentences.english: The bush acted as a cushion to my fall.
sentences.chinese: 解除敵對國之間緩衝區域的軍事管制。

sentences.english: We consider this to be a hostile action.
sentences.chinese: 我艦認爲這是敵對行爲。

sentences.english: The Red Shirts and the government are both insisting that the other side call off hostilities first.
sentences.chinese: 紅衫軍和政府均堅持由對方首先叫停敵對狀態。

sentences.english: Enemy units previously revealed will no longer be targetable.
sentences.chinese: 之前的倖存的敵對單位將不再成爲目標。

sentences.english: Let's hop they will refrain from hostile action.
sentences.chinese: 希望他們能剋制不採取敵對行動。

definition: to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
to control/to curb/to restrict/to impede/to pin down (enemy troops)
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
